boat.name: Selkie
boat.full_description:
There is evidence that, like Heard's early Picarooners, Selkie had a mizzen mast on the port quarter and may have been lug-rigged. She then had a taller mast, longer bowsprit and a gaff rig. She may have had an outboard well installed and was kept on a swinging mooring in the West Country.

She was bought in 2006 by a Mr Bullough, in Bere Ferris, who launched her twice. Oliver and Susan Nares purchased her in 2010 and have carried out much work. They have installed a hatch in the foredeck and both the fore and afterdecks now have laid iroko decking. Buoyancy tanks have been made for each side with side benches above. The cockpit has a slatted iroko floor and the running rigging has been improved. She retains her original tan main, but now has a slightly larger cream jib.
boat.short_description: Owners Oliver and Susan Nares believe the hull was made at Martin Heard's yard and completed as a ‘home build’ , probably by one of his workforce.
